name: hasteola suaveolens
description: Other Scientific Names in use: Cacalia suaveolens and Synosma suaveolens Other Common Names in use: False Indian Plantain, Sweet-scented Indian Plantain  Sweet Indian Plantain is rhizomatous.Â Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
